author: Im cool

text:
The developer of Baten Kaitos...oh this game got my attention back in 2007 I guess!
I thought "this has to be good it's from the company who made Baten Kaitos I & II

Boy it was a game! The graphic was nice, I loved the characters but the story was...well I played it again just to understand Â (SPOILER) and I have to say it's a pretty deep and dark story of a little girl who is trapped in an endless spiral of pain and sorrow! Just to live this life over and over again until a yound man entered her world. He's living on the edge of life! A place where he is close to death. After that, the story of that girl changed for the first time and she was able to change her fate.
At the end she was falling in love...a girl who was avoided all the time, who never was loved by anyone because of her illness! I really REALLY love the story!Â 

It's brilliant in it self! So many hints and you really have to pay attention to it, because it's not so easy to understand! The music is a masterpiece! Well it's from Motoi Sakuraba! He is my favourite VGM composer afterall : )

text: The battle system "evolves" by holding back a lot of it's features for most of the game, thus being very one-dimensional for a long time. Even at full potential the fights still have less depth than most other JRPGs of the last few generations...it just gets even more reaction tests. And about "telling a story" of a real life person...yeah that is unique but also nothing more than a badly implemented gimmick and also overall pointless because Frederic only played a siderole for most of the game!
author: GFlÃ¼gel

text: Cookie-cutter? You've GOT to be kidding me. A truly unique battle system that actually evolves as you play on, a plot that literally is all happening inside someone's head, AND it breaks the "pure gaming" barrier by telling the story of a phenomenal composer who actually existed in real life. Please, tell me what other games include those elements.
author: rpjordan

text: Absolutely amazing soundtrack, maybe one of the best of all time for the genre. Shame that it was wasted on such a unispired excuse for a cookie-cutter JRPG. Then again, without the fantastic music I would've quit after a few hours. Instead I started kinda enjoying the unchallenging but flashy battles and made fun of the nonsensical plot and terrible cutscenes. Props to Sakuraba once again.

text: This is such a beautiful game, really... Yes, there are some minor points that could be improved, but the overal experience just blows them all away. Use a program called Audacity.

What you need to do is download it, set it to record through your speakers, and then get lame_enc.dll in order to export it as an mp3. 

A bit of warning, you need a seperate sound card in order to record through a laptop, and you need to set up the microphone settings to be your speakers if you run Windows Vista.
